column5: We headed to Chuck Lake Y. En route, on the way in, Colin and I both paused in the canoe and we tilted our heads back, inhaling through our nostrils. We could smell wood burning, most likely a campfire. Chuck's truck wasn't parked where we had started paddling, but maybe he came in through another route? Well, Chuck wasn't there and Colin took advantage and caught 2 good ones.
I was poking around the day before but I know Colin likes catching the big ones so I left them alone.
Nice!  Never caught one of those beauties. Do they fight more like lakers or brookies?
The bigger ones seem to bulldog and resist for a long time but no crazy runs or acrobatics
Nice catch. I haven't fished for them in decades. Use to go to Owen Sound
